intro: Rhynchospora simplex, commonly known as the simple beak rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, triangular stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate spikes, a characteristic feature of many Cyperaceae species. Rhynchospora simplex plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
